speaker: WOO
line: Come on Fong. Don't be scared. Okay, here it is. I saw them load it in Hong Kong.

speaker: FONG
line: Tell me what you think is inside.

speaker: WOO
line: Yesterday I put my face close to the box. The thing inside tried to bite me.

speaker: FONG
line: Maybe it's a tiger.

speaker: WOO
line: Come on, Fong. Take a look. With eyes like that, how can it be a tiger?

speaker: WOO
line: I think we killed it.

speaker: YEE
line: This hold was secured in Hong Kong. I don't know how this happened. It makes no sense. We found the cage still locked. Two of my men are missing.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Who's in charge here? You?

speaker: YEE
line: Who are you?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: My name is Detweiler. I'm the owner of this cargo. I was to be notified immediately of its arrival. There's an animal in here, damn it. It needs care.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aren't you going home?

speaker: MULDER
line: I am home. I'm just feathering the nest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What you got?

speaker: MULDER
line: Two merchant marines found dead this morning in San Pedro … in the hold of their cargo ship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mind if I ask the cause of death?

speaker: MULDER
line: On the crime report it says multiple bite wounds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Hong Kong manifest has the cargo listed as a dog.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A dog? A "dog" dog?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yo quiero Taco Bell. That alone is not what drew me to this case. The two men were found inside the container. It was locked from the outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to the dog?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dog gone…. Dog gone… Doggone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I got it. Did anybody, um, examine the victims, Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, bite wounds are rarely lethal in themselves. I mean, they are not the cause of death. They lead to it through the loss of blood, but, uh... it makes you wonder how accurate this report is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Local PD wrote it up. Department of Fish and Wildlife is on the case. I got an outside source says it was a dog.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I don't have to tell you how absolutely and completely wrong that seems. I mean, they were found dead in a locked cage, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two grown men?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not going to tell me that a dog did this.

speaker: MULDER
line: A bad dog.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: JAKE CONROY
line: Shh. Quiet. Jo-Jo, come on. Shh. Shh. Shh. That's enough now. Come on. Come on. Come on. It's okay.

speaker: JAKE CONROY
line: Hey, get out of here. Go on, git! Come on, inside. Come on. Come on. Inside. Inside. Inside, Jo-Jo.

speaker: JAKE CONROY
line: Get out of here. Go on home. Go home.

speaker: JAKE CONROY
line: Jo-Jo? Here, girl. You better not be on the bed. There you are. What are you doing, girl? You nut. Big ol' lazy bones. Jo-Jo, what are you doing...?

speaker: JAKE CONROY
line: Stay away. Go on.

speaker: MULDER
line: Officer Jeffrey Cahn?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Yeah?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Special Agent Fox Mulder with the FBI. This is my partner, Dana Scully. I think the LA field office would have contacted you that we were coming down today.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Oh, yeah. I hope you don't mind - I had to look around the ship with my men. We were pretty thorough.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you find?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Nothing conclusive, really, but I can tell you the dog's not likely still on the ship.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you determine that?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: You ever owned a dog, sir?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Had to clean up after it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't suppose you can tell us what kind of dog this is.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: I'm not really sure. The man it was shipped to's name is Detweiler. Dr. Ian Detweiler. Calls himself a "cryptozoologist."

speaker: MULDER
line: Cryptozoologist?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: They deal with animals thought to be extinct.

speaker: MULDER
line: Animals that aren't supposed to exist like Sasquatch and the Ogopogo and the Abominable Snowman and - - -

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't mind him. He'll go on forever. Did you have a chance to talk to this Dr. Detweiler?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: About five minutes ago.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Officer Cahn, any progress?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Agents, this is Dr. Detweiler.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Are you from the FBI?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Who should I be speaking to about the theft of this animal?

speaker: MULDER
line: Theft? What do you mean theft?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: This is a very valuable animal that's disappeared. A rare breed and arguably a priceless specimen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A breed of what?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Wanshang Dhole. It's a canid.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's an Asian dog. Supposed to have been extinct for the last 150 years.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Yes. That's right, actually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you have one of these?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I was on the expedition that caught it.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Be that as it may-- we now have an unquarantined animal loose.

speaker: MULDER
line: Loose? Sounds a little more than loose. It seems to have killed two people.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: No. No. Let me assure you this is not a predatory animal. Chinese folklore has imbued it with mythic qualities. But it doesn't even hunt-- it scavenges.

speaker: COP
line: Where's Officer Cahn? Hey, Jeff, I just got a report on the radio. Some kind of vicious dog attack in Bellflower.

speaker: MULDER
line: Watch your step.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jake Conroy, age 30. He was employed as a customs agent by the Federal Government. The bite marks match those of the victims on the Chinese freighter. In this case, it bit off the man's hand. There's some talk in the house that he may be involved in the theft of the animal and that it turned on him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Talk about biting the hand that feeds you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it does make sense. I mean, a victim and his dog are attacked inside of a house with all the doors shut. It couldn't have happened unless the dog was being kept inside.

speaker: MULDER
line: If all the doors were shut, how did it get out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we're speaking in too common terms about an animal we're calling a dog but which displays none of the behavior of man's best friend.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean covering up crime scenes?

speaker: MULDER
line: You get a biscuit, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, you're talking about a dog that has human intelligence. Well, even if there were such an animal where would we even begin to look for one?

speaker: MULDER
line: With a human that thinks like an animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin? Karin Berquist?

speaker: STACY MUIR
line: No. Stacy Muir. Just putting up this fence for her. She's been having some coyote problems. You two looking for Karin about boarding?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it's actually more of a behavior problem.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, he doesn't listen and he chews on the furniture.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just... can you tell her the FBI's here to see her?

speaker: STACY MUIR
line: Right this way.

speaker: STACY MUIR
line: Karin will be out in a moment, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You sure this woman's not an authority on bats?

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin Berquist knows more about canine behaviorisms than anybody on the planet. She's lived with wild canids and wolves in the wilderness on five different continents.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is it that you know so much about her but you don't know what she looks like?

speaker: MULDER
line: I never actually met her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you assume that she's going to help us?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually, it's not an assumption. She is the one who told me about his case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, so you two are chummy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I've read her books.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ah. The Wolf Inside... Dogs Don't Lie... Better Than Human... Better Than Human?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's not a real people person.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she seems to have made a connection to you.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: All right... Settle down. Settle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin, I'm Fox. Fox Mulder. This is my partner, Dana Scully. It's nice to finally meet you.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I wish I'd known. I don't get many visitors. Stacy tells me you have a question about behaviorism?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, it's about the animal I'm tracking. The one you mentioned in your e-mail - about its intelligence.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Canids' intelligence is far superior to ours if that's what you want to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Intelligence enough to murder?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Murder takes no intelligence. It's a human behaviorism.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about hunting?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Coyotes use elaborate trickeries to draw out their prey. Many canids do... alone or in packs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about a Dhole?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: If you mean the Wanshang Dhole, it's extinct. Is there any other reason you came here?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Thank you, Karin.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... She's a friend of yours?

speaker: MULDER
line: We met on-line.

speaker: SCULLY
line: On-line...

speaker: MULDER
line: Two professionals exchanging information.

speaker: OFFICER FIEDLER
line: This is Fiedler. I'm at an alley just south of Cooper in Signal Hill. Looks like something's been scavenging. I'm going to check it out.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: Copy that.

speaker: OFFICER FIEDLER
line: Hey! Hello, sir. I'm with US Fish and Wildlife. Maybe you've seen a dog I'm looking for.

speaker: OFFICER FEIDLER
line: Sir? Can you hear me?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: You want to catch a killer? You arrest that crypto son of a bitch who shipped that dog over here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it the same dog?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: That's Frank Fiedler over there. He's a friend of mine. Damn good at his job. You think this kind of thing happens here every day?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm sure it doesn't. We're just trying to catch this animal just like you though, sir.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Oh, you can catch it. I want to kill it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think wolfwoman is here to speak to me about this. I'll take a look at the body.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't expect you.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: "Dog eats dogcatcher." Story's all over the news this morning. It's sort of uplifting.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I'm joking.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's okay.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I thought you might use some help.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said that a dog or a canid only hunts what it needs but I've got four bodies with bite marks on it from an animal that seems to kill for no other reason.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Who are the victims?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's two men on the ship that it came in on, a customs agent, and now an officer from Fish and Wildlife. In fact, all these men could have come in contact with the animal before the attacks.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Classic dominant-alpha territorial behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. This animal seems to have ranged many miles to make its attacks. In each case it seems to have outsmarted or at least tricked its victims.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Unlike we homo sapiens a canid's motives are simple and direct. It would be an extraordinary case to find one who kills for sport. Likely, we may never know. I'm sure someone will kill it first.

speaker: MULDER
line: This guy over here? He claims to have caught it once. Maybe he can catch it again. He's Dr. Ian Detweiler. Do you know him?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: No, but I dislike him already.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I've been over the area. If that was my animal there's absolutely no evidence of it-- no prints, nothing whatsoever I can find.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it's still on the loose.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: How did you say you caught it originally?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, this is Karin Berquist.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: We tranquilized it after tracking it for two weeks.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: You admire it, don't you?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I admire its ability to survive.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Think I'll look around, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Now, that's one strange bird.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: No, I'm leaving my dart gun in the car. I'm going to live rounds from here on out. I don't care what the regulations say. I shouldn't be asked to risk my life and neither should anyone else.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: No one's asking you to risk your life, Cahn.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Fiedler's lying dead. You realize that?

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: Cahn, you still there?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Look, we need more men out here. How more many people have to go down before you guys listen? Look, I don't have a photo of this animal. No one's even seen it. Let's get more men out here so we can catch it and kill it. If you want …

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: You scared me.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: You kill that dog, and I'll kill you.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: This man Detweiler said he could find no evidence at the scene but with very little effort I was able to find several tracks on the floor of the building where the man was attacked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did they tell you anything?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: That this is a large, rangy animal with primitive, even pre-evolutionary aspects. It isn't perfectly visible, but with the computer I can enhance the prints so that you can see it. A fifth toe pad on the right paw. Canids only have four toes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, he's got a vestigial toe pad on his front paws. Right there.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: The dewclaw, serving no purpose now. Although some believe it was once a prehensile thumb.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And that's what you think the print indicates?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I am told this animal went in and out of closed buildings.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just yesterday you dismissed the possibility outright, that a dog or a... a canid, as you call it, would behave like this.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I dismissed the idea of murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you'll accept the idea that it behaves in every other way like Jack the Ripper.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I'm just going by the facts. In Chinese myth the Dhole can be evil, capable of opening doors, stealing wives and disappearing into thin air. Maybe there is some basis in reality for this trickster myth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, I'm... fairly certain there is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Everything okay, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How well do you know this woman, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: How well do you know anybody you meet on the Internet? She likes to talk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I question her motives.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're suggesting that this case was a way to get me out here, to meet me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm flattered, but, no. I don't know this woman. I'd go out on a limb and say there's no way in hell she has anything to do with those four people being dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's enamored of you, Mulder. Don't underestimate a woman. They can be tricksters, too.

speaker: ANGIE
line: So Dr. Riley wanted me to give Duke three pills a day. Is the one bottle going to be enough?

speaker: PEGGY
line: Oh, we can get you a refill.

speaker: ANGIE
line: Okay.

speaker: ANGIE
line: Duke… Duke … enough!

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Can't you control your dog?

speaker: ANGIE
line: I'm sorry. He gets this way with strangers sometimes.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Let's take him outside.

speaker: ANGIE
line: Duke, come on.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Excuse me. You got him? Good luck.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Sorry about that. It's usually a well-behaved dog.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I'm Dr. Detweiler. I called about the animal tranquilizer.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: The Telezol. I don't have much occasion to dispense it. If I have any, it's very little.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Well, I'll take whatever you've got.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: I have Etorphine. Can you use that?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Can I ask what these tranqs are for?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: An animal escaped from a pier in San Pedro.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Not that dog that's been attacking people?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: If you don't mind, I'm in a bit of a hurry.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Uh, this dog you're looking for-- you're not looking around here?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I'm afraid we are.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Good night, Peggy.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING
line: PEGGY: Good night.]

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Uh, be sure to relock that front door for me, would you? And I'll relock the back.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING
line: PEGGY: Sure.]

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Good night, Sparky. Bye, Dino.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Hey, Buck. What's wrong, Buck? What's wrong, Buck?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Come on!

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Where is it?

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: He's trapped in a kennel behind that door.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: How'd it get in there?

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Uh, it must have come around back.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Lowell and Shoen, go around back. All right, I'm going to open the door. Doc, you're going to have to move back. I'm going to have to shoot him. See him!

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: You hit him?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: I think so. He's down.

speaker: DR JAMES RILEY
line: Duke... It's the wrong dog.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Came out for nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Took out somebody's pet.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of pet?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: St. Bernard. It was dark. I just saw something moving.

speaker: DR RILEY
line: Okay, Duke... All done, pal. You're going to be all right. Now we got find out how you got back in here, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a federal agent. I'm armed. If you can hear me, don't move. Just stay where you are and tell me if you're okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll call the paramedics.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Where's Fox?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Continuing his investigation.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: You're not working together?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. This is my investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I have no idea what you mean.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought at first that they were eccentricities or affectations-- the dark, the clothes-- but it's photosensitivity. Your sleeves cover up skin lesions. It's why you're here amongst the humans instead of out in the field. Systemic lupus erythematosus.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Lupus... From the Latin for "wolf." Ironic, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ironic or perverse?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I've ignored the symptoms for years. I've always felt more like a wolf than a person.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But not with Mulder. With Mulder, you found somebody you could communicate with.... someone who challenged you... But that wasn't enough. You needed to lure him out here.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I lack your feminine wiles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't believe it, do you-- not for a minute-- that there's an animal out there killing?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I don't believe that this man, Dr. Detweiler, ever caught it. I lived in Asia. I know about the Wanshang Dhole and if it survived for over a century it was because it was more cunning than man, more cunning than this man Detweiler ever dreamed of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More cunning than you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm watching you.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: You watch... But you don't see.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: Officer Cahn, we have an emergency phone call we'd like to patch through to you. Officer Cahn, are you there? Officer Cahn, please respond. Officer Cahn? Please respond.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: This is Jeffrey Cahn. Go ahead.

speaker: DISPATCHER
line: We have an FBI agent holding for you. I'm going to patch him through now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Officer Cahn?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I'm back at the animal clinic. You know Detweiler had been here.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Dr. Detweiler was there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. He signed for something. It looks like, uh... Eet... Etorfeen, Etorphine?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Tranquilizers-- ampules.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you anywhere near here at all?

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: Not far. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: You have access to a lab. There's something I'd like you to check for me.

speaker: OFFICER JEFFREY CAHN
line: I'll be there in 15 minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I'd heard what had happened. I didn't know how bad he would be. I thought I might get a description of the animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you learn about the attack?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I'd been in contact with Officer Cahn. I learned through his office.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you didn't. No, you hadn't. Officer Cahn didn't want to have anything to do with you.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: He was going to kill it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does that frighten you?

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Please, sir. This is ridiculous.

speaker: MULDER
line: You aren't hunting this animal. You know very well it can't be caught.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: Then how did I bring it here?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what no one can figure out except for Karin Berquist. She knows what was in that cage and she knows it must be killed and that's the thought she can't bear because she doesn't want this thing to be extinct anymore than you do.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: You're not making any sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think I am. You went to China looking for that animal and you may have tracked it as you claim but the rest is far from the truth. You found the Wanshang Dhole, but you never caught it. It caught you. You may not have known what was happening to you at first but you're well aware now-- that when night comes, you stop being yourself.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: That's insane.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you become the trickster-- a shape-shifting man who becomes an animal.

speaker: DETWEILER
line: I've heard enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. You killed because you could. You may have resisted it at first. You may have hated what you'd become. Eventually it took you over. That's where the tranquilizer came in. I found traces of Etorphine and animal blood at the clinic. You injected yourself with the tranquilizer hoping to stop the killings... But they didn't and they haven't and they won't.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I protected you as long as I could. I won't any longer.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I can usually get a sense of a person right away from the dogs. Dogs are the best judges of character I know.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sensing something myself here. I'm thinking maybe I've been misled, that you haven't been totally honest with me about this case.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I've been honest with you, though perhaps not myself. I was looking forward to meeting you. I wouldn't admit how much.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you might also have admitted what you knew about this animal-- that it wasn't an animal at all.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I heard the reports and called you out if only so you could disprove them. What I knew was it couldn't be a dog responsible for those killings.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Detweiler, isn't it?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you knew that and didn't say.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: I only realized it when I saw him. My failure was in thinking I was protecting the animal that by deceiving you, it might be captured alive. He's got to be put down, Fox. It's the only way to stop this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've got Scully on him, tailing him watching his every move.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: He'll elude her easily.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, where's he going to go?

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: To the man he only wounded-- to the hospital, to finish the kill.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me. You got to get to the hospital. … You got to make sure Cahn is protected. … Yeah, he's in danger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now tell me why you pulled me away from the suspect and chained me to this chair 'cause I haven't seen hide nor hair of Detweiler since I've been here.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's aptly put... but it's not yet dark. You should take a load off. We might be here all night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Detweiler... but it's not Detweiler. It's something that he becomes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Through some blood curse, this man undergoes some kind of nocturnal transformation. He becomes the same shape-shifting trickster as that mythical dog.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what is he going to do? Walk in here, skitter across the linoleum and pee in the corners?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's about territoriality. He's going to come back here tonight to make sure his dominance isn't challenged. He's going to put down the threat he failed to eliminate when he attacked Cahn. Karin Berquist confirmed it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the only thing Karin Berquist is interested in is you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're kidding yourself if you think that she hasn't manipulated this entire situation for her own purposes.

speaker: MULDER
line: He'll come here tonight, Scully. You'll see.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. He's not coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you've got no argument from me.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's not coming here tonight. Karin knew that. She lied to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Karin, it's Fox Mulder. If you can hear me, I know what you're doing. If you can hear me, lock your doors. I'm on my way.

speaker: KARIN BERQUIST
line: Come on, dog. Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.... It's Detweiler.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You going home?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, pretty soon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think this is your fault.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that I... believed her very quickly. I think maybe that was my fault, yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why wouldn't you believe her?

speaker: MULDER
line: I barely knew her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she had a lot of secrets, that's for sure. I think that Karin Berquist lived by her instincts. She sized people up pretty quickly and I think she figured you out to a "T." I think she saw in you a kindred spirit, Mulder. She may not have been able to express that to you. Maybe what she did was the highest form of compliment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You going to be okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh. This came for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.
